question:
Match the conducting tissues of heart in Column I with their respective location given in Column II and select the correct option given below.
Column I: (A) SAN, (B) AVN, (C) Purkinje fibers, (D) Bundle of His.
Column II: (I) Interventricular septum, (II) At the base of opening of superior vena cava, (III) Right atrial wall near base of interatrial septum, (IV) Network located in right and left ventricular walls. [2022]
question_latex: Match the conducting tissues of heart in Column I with their respective location given in Column II and select the correct option given below. \\ \textbf{Column I}: (A) SAN, (B) AVN, (C) Purkinje fibers, (D) Bundle of His. \\ \textbf{Column II}: (I) Interventricular septum, (II) At the base of opening of superior vena cava, (III) Right atrial wall near base of interatrial septum, (IV) Network located in right and left ventricular walls. [2022]
options: A. A - II, B - III, C - I, D - IV
B. A - II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
C. A - III, B - II, C - IV, D - I
D. A - IV, B - III, C - I, D - II
answer: B. A - II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
solution: The SAN is located at the base of the superior vena cava (II). The AVN is in the right atrial wall near the interatrial septum (III). Purkinje fibers form a network in the ventricular walls (IV). The Bundle of His is located in the interventricular septum (I).

question: Lymph contains [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Lymph contains [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Lymph is a fluid connective tissue similar to blood but lacks RBCs, platelets, and large proteins. it primarily consists of WBCs (lymphocytes) and intercellular fluid.

question: Adam's apple is also called
question_latex: Adam's apple is also called
solution: The larynx is known as the voice box or Adam's apple, which is more prominent in adult males due to the growth of thyroid cartilage under the influence of testosterone.

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the conducting system of the heart? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is correct regarding the conducting system of the heart? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. AVN is called pace maker of the heart.
B. Purkinje fibers are present in the wall of atria.
C. SAN is located in the left atrium.
D. The rhythm of heart is set by SAN.
answer: D. The rhythm of heart is set by SAN.
solution: The SAN (Sino-atrial node) is the pacemaker of the heart as it initiates the cardiac impulse and sets the heart's rhythm. It is located in the right atrium.

question: The percentage of $CO_{2}$ transported in the form of bicarbonates is
question_latex: The percentage of $CO_{2}$ transported in the form of bicarbonates is
solution: About $70\%$ of $CO_{2}$ is transported as bicarbonate ions ($HCO_{3}^{-}$) in the plasma. Approximately $7\%$ is in dissolved state and $23\%$ as carbamino-haemoglobin.

question: Identify the type of respiration in which the respiratory organ is the skin. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the type of respiration in which the respiratory organ is the skin. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Cutaneous respiration is the exchange of gases through the skin, common in organisms like earthworms and amphibians (frogs).

question: Identify the correct match of the blood vessel and its function. (I) Pulmonary artery - Carries oxygenated blood to lungs, (II) Pulmonary vein - Carries oxygenated blood to heart, (III) Systemic aorta - Carries deoxygenated blood to body parts, (IV) Vena cava - Carries oxygenated blood from body parts. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Identify the correct match of the blood vessel and its function. \\ (I) Pulmonary artery - Carries oxygenated blood to lungs \\ (II) Pulmonary vein - Carries oxygenated blood to heart \\ (III) Systemic aorta - Carries deoxygenated blood to body parts \\ (IV) Vena cava - Carries oxygenated blood from body parts. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Pulmonary veins are the only veins that carry oxygenated blood (from lungs to the left atrium). Pulmonary arteries carry deoxygenated blood to lungs.

question: The volume of air inspired or expired during normal breathing is called [MHT CET 2004]
question_latex: The volume of air inspired or expired during normal breathing is called [MHT CET 2004]
solution: Tidal Volume ($TV$) is the volume of air inspired or expired during a normal respiration cycle, which is approximately $500$ mL in a healthy man.

question: Serum is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: Serum is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: Serum is the liquid part of blood that remains after blood has clotted. It is essentially plasma without fibrinogen and other clotting factors.

question: The instrument used to measure blood pressure is [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: The instrument used to measure blood pressure is [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: A sphygmomanometer is the medical instrument used to measure arterial blood pressure.

question: In a healthy adult man, the normal systolic and diastolic blood pressure is ........ and ........ respectively. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In a healthy adult man, the normal systolic and diastolic blood pressure is ........ and ........ respectively. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The average normal blood pressure is $120/80$ mmHg. $120$ mmHg is the systolic pressure (during contraction) and $80$ mmHg is the diastolic pressure (during relaxation).

question: The largest corpuscles in human blood are
question_latex: The largest corpuscles in human blood are
solution: Monocytes are the largest type of white blood cells (leukocytes) in the peripheral blood, characterized by a kidney-shaped nucleus.

question: The heart sound 'Lubb' is produced due to [MHT CET 2005]
question_latex: The heart sound 'Lubb' is produced due to [MHT CET 2005]
solution: The first heart sound 'Lubb' (S1) is produced by the sudden closure of the Atrio-ventricular (Tricuspid and Bicuspid) valves at the start of ventricular systole.

question: Which of the following is NOT an agranulocyte? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which of the following is NOT an agranulocyte? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Eosinophils, Neutrophils, and Basophils are granulocytes (contain granules in cytoplasm). Monocytes and Lymphocytes are agranulocytes.

question: The layer of heart that is made up of cardiac muscles is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The layer of heart that is made up of cardiac muscles is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The myocardium is the thick, middle layer of the heart wall composed of specialized cardiac muscle tissue.

question: During inspiration, the diaphragm [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: During inspiration, the diaphragm [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Inhalation begins with the contraction of the diaphragm, which flattens out to increase the volume of the thoracic cavity.

question: Bicuspid valve is also known as [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Bicuspid valve is also known as [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The bicuspid valve, located between the left atrium and left ventricle, is commonly called the mitral valve.

question: Universal recipient blood group is [MHT CET 2009]
question_latex: Universal recipient blood group is [MHT CET 2009]
solution: Individuals with blood group $AB$ are universal recipients because their plasma lacks antibodies against both A and B antigens.

question: Match the following respiratory surfaces with organisms. (a) Lungs - (i) Scorpion, (b) Gills - (ii) Human, (c) Book lungs - (iii) Fish, (d) Trachea - (iv) Cockroach. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match the following respiratory surfaces with organisms. \\ (a) Lungs --- (ii) Human \\ (b) Gills --- (iii) Fish \\ (c) Book lungs --- (i) Scorpion \\ (d) Trachea --- (iv) Cockroach. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Humans use lungs; fish use gills; scorpions possess book lungs; insects like cockroaches use a tracheal system.

question: What is the life span of RBCs in humans? [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: What is the life span of RBCs in humans? [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Red Blood Cells (Erythrocytes) circulate for an average of $120$ days before being destroyed in the spleen and liver.

question: A person with 'O' blood group has [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: A person with 'O' blood group has [MHT-CET 2021]
options: A. Antigen A and B on RBCs
solution: Blood group 'O' is characterized by the absence of both A and B antigens on the surface of the RBCs.

question: The state of heart when it is NOT pumping blood effectively to meet needs of body is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The state of heart when it is NOT pumping blood effectively to meet needs of body is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Heart failure (congestive heart failure) is a chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.

question: Which of the following prevents the collapse of the trachea? [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Which of the following prevents the collapse of the trachea? [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The trachea is supported by $16$ to $20$ C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage that prevent it from collapsing during inspiration.

question: The total volume of air a person can breathe in after a forced expiration is [MHT CET 2011]
question_latex: The total volume of air a person can breathe in after a forced expiration is [MHT CET 2011]
solution: Vital Capacity ($VC$) is the maximum volume of air a person can breathe out after a maximum inspiration (or breathe in after maximum expiration). $VC = ERV + TV + IRV$.

question: Normal cardiac output in a healthy person is about
question_latex: Normal cardiac output in a healthy person is about
solution: Cardiac output = Stroke volume ($70$ ml) $\times$ Heart rate ($72$ bpm) $\approx 5040$ ml or roughly $5$ liters per minute.

question: Hemoglobin consists of ........ polypeptide chains. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Hemoglobin consists of ........ polypeptide chains. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: A hemoglobin molecule is a quaternary protein composed of four polypeptide chains (two alpha and two beta chains in adults).

question: Rh-negative mother carrying Rh-positive fetus can lead to [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Rh-negative mother carrying Rh-positive fetus can lead to [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: This condition occurs when Rh antibodies from an Rh- mother cross the placenta and attack the RBCs of an Rh+ fetus.

question: Identify the blood group which contains both 'a' and 'b' antibodies in plasma. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the blood group which contains both 'a' and 'b' antibodies in plasma. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Blood group 'O' has no antigens on RBCs but contains both anti-A and anti-B antibodies in the plasma.

question: The respiratory center is located in the [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: The respiratory center is located in the [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The respiratory rhythm center is located in the medulla oblongata of the brain, which regulates the pace of breathing.

question: Pulmonary circulation involves [MHT-CET 2015]
question_latex: Pulmonary circulation involves [MHT-CET 2015]
options: A. Right ventricle -> lungs -> left atrium
B. Left ventricle -> body -> right atrium
C. Right atrium -> lungs -> left ventricle
D. Left atrium -> lungs -> right atrium
answer: A. Right ventricle -> lungs -> left atrium
solution: Pulmonary circulation is the circuit that carries deoxygenated blood from the right ventricle to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood to the left atrium.

question: The shift in oxygen dissociation curve to the right due to increased $CO_{2}$ is called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The shift in oxygen dissociation curve to the right due to increased $CO_{2}$ is called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The Bohr effect describes the decrease in hemoglobin's affinity for oxygen in response to increased $CO_{2}$ concentration and acidity ($pH$ decrease).

question: Granulocytes include [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Granulocytes include [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Granulocytes are white blood cells with secretory granules in their cytoplasm; the three types are neutrophils, eosinophils, and basophils.

question: Which of the following valves prevents the backflow of blood into the right atrium? [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Which of the following valves prevents the backflow of blood into the right atrium? [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The tricuspid valve is situated between the right atrium and the right ventricle; it prevents blood from flowing back into the atrium during ventricular contraction.

question: Partial pressure of oxygen ($pO_{2}$) in alveolar air is [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Partial pressure of oxygen ($pO_{2}$) in alveolar air is [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: In the alveoli, the $pO_{2}$ is approximately $104$ mmHg, while the $pCO_{2}$ is $40$ mmHg.

question: The space between the two pleural membranes is filled with [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The space between the two pleural membranes is filled with [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The pleural cavity between the parietal and visceral pleura contains pleural fluid which reduces friction during lung expansion and contraction.

question: Blood platelets are also called [MHT CET 2008]
question_latex: Blood platelets are also called [MHT CET 2008]
solution: Platelets are disk-shaped cell fragments involved in blood clotting and are scientifically known as thrombocytes.

question: The duration of one cardiac cycle is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: The duration of one cardiac cycle is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: At a normal heart rate of $75$ bpm, one cardiac cycle lasts $0.8$ seconds (Atrial systole $0.1$s, Ventricular systole $0.3$s, Joint diastole $0.4$s).

question: Identify the incorrect pair regarding ECG. (A) P-wave - Atrial depolarization, (B) QRS complex - Ventricular depolarization, (C) T-wave - Ventricular repolarization, (D) QRS complex - Atrial repolarization. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the incorrect pair regarding ECG. (A) P-wave - Atrial depolarization, (B) QRS complex - Ventricular depolarization, (C) T-wave - Ventricular repolarization, (D) QRS complex - Atrial repolarization. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Atrial repolarization is not visible on a standard ECG as it is masked by the larger QRS complex (Ventricular depolarization).

question: The exchange of gases between blood and tissues is called [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: The exchange of gases between blood and tissues is called [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Internal respiration (tissue respiration) is the exchange of gases between the blood in capillaries and the body cells.

question: Double circulation means [MHT CET 2012]
question_latex: Double circulation means [MHT CET 2012]
options: A. Blood flows through the heart once in a cycle
B. Blood flows through the heart twice in a cycle
C. Oxygenated and deoxygenated blood mix
answer: B. Blood flows through the heart twice in a cycle
solution: In birds and mammals, blood passes through the heart twice for every one complete circuit of the body, preventing mixing of oxygenated and deoxygenated blood.

question: In a healthy person, the count of blood platelets is about ........ per $mm^{3}$. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: In a healthy person, the count of blood platelets is about ........ per $mm^{3}$. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The normal platelet count in a healthy human ranges from $1.5$ to $3.5$ lakh per cubic millimeter of blood.

question: Identify the disease characterized by the chronic inflammation of the bronchi and bronchioles. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the disease characterized by the chronic inflammation of the bronchi and bronchioles. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Asthma is a chronic respiratory disease involving inflammation and narrowing of the airways, often triggered by allergens.

question: Haldane effect is associated with [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Haldane effect is associated with [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The Haldane effect describes how oxygenated hemoglobin has a lower affinity for $CO_{2}$, facilitating $CO_{2}$ release in the lungs.

question: In humans, the vocal cords are situated in [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: In humans, the vocal cords are situated in [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Two elastic vocal cords are stretched across the larynx; air passing through them vibrates to produce sound.

question: The tricuspid valve is present between [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: The tricuspid valve is present between [MHT-CET 2014]
options: A. Left atrium and left ventricle
B. Right atrium and right ventricle
C. Right ventricle and pulmonary artery
answer: B. Right atrium and right ventricle
solution: The right atrioventricular opening is guarded by the tricuspid valve, which has three flaps or cusps.

question: Red color of blood is due to [MHT CET 2003]
question_latex: Red color of blood is due to [MHT CET 2003]
solution: Hemoglobin is an iron-containing respiratory pigment in RBCs that gives blood its characteristic red color when oxygenated.

question: A rise in WBC count is called [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: A rise in WBC count is called [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Leukocytosis is a temporary increase in the number of WBCs, often occurring during infection. Leukemia is an abnormal/uncontrolled increase (blood cancer).

question: The percentage of oxygen transported by RBCs is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The percentage of oxygen transported by RBCs is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: About $97\%$ of oxygen is transported in chemical combination with hemoglobin in RBCs as oxyhemoglobin. The remaining $3\%$ is dissolved in plasma.

question: Which of the following is responsible for the formation of blood clots? [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Which of the following is responsible for the formation of blood clots? [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: Fibrinogen is a plasma protein synthesized in the liver that is converted into fibrin threads during the process of blood coagulation.

question: Systemic circulation starts from [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: Systemic circulation starts from [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: Systemic circulation begins when oxygenated blood is pumped from the left ventricle into the systemic aorta to be distributed to the whole body.

question: Residual Volume ($RV$) in a healthy human is about [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Residual Volume ($RV$) in a healthy human is about [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Residual Volume is the volume of air remaining in the lungs even after a forceful expiration; it is typically between $1100$ and $1200$ mL.

question: Which of the following blood cells are phagocytic? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which of the following blood cells are phagocytic? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Neutrophils and monocytes are the primary phagocytic cells that engulf and destroy foreign pathogens in the blood and tissues.

question: P-wave in an ECG represents [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: P-wave in an ECG represents [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The P-wave is the first wave in an ECG and corresponds to the electrical activation (depolarization) of the atria.

question: Hematuria means [MHT CET 2007]
question_latex: Hematuria means [MHT CET 2007]
options: A. Presence of blood in urine
B. Presence of glucose in urine
C. Presence of protein in urine
answer: A. Presence of blood in urine
solution: Hematuria is the medical term for the presence of red blood cells (blood) in the urine.

question: Total Lung Capacity ($TLC$) is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Total Lung Capacity ($TLC$) is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: $TLC$ is the total volume of air in the lungs after a maximum inspiration. $TLC = VC (Vital Capacity) + RV (Residual Volume)$.

question: Which of the following prevents the backflow of blood into the left ventricle? [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Which of the following blood vessel prevents the backflow of blood into the left ventricle? [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The aortic semilunar valve, located at the base of the systemic aorta, prevents blood from re-entering the left ventricle during diastole.

question: Artificial pacemaker is used in patients suffering from [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: Artificial pacemaker is used in patients suffering from [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: When the natural pacemaker (SAN) fails or the conducting system is blocked, an electronic pacemaker is implanted to regulate heart beats.

question: Carbonic anhydrase enzyme is found in high concentration in [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Carbonic anhydrase enzyme is found in high concentration in [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: RBCs contain a high concentration of carbonic anhydrase, which catalyzes the rapid reversible reaction of $CO_{2}$ and $H_{2}O$ to form carbonic acid.

question: What is the normal heart rate in a healthy adult? [MHT-CET 2015]
question_latex: What is the normal heart rate in a healthy adult? [MHT-CET 2015]
solution: The average resting heart rate for a healthy adult is approximately $72$ beats per minute (bpm), typically ranging from $72$ to $80$ bpm.

question: A rise in RBC count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: A rise in RBC count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Polycythemia is an increase in the number of RBCs, which can occur naturally at high altitudes or as a pathological condition.

question: Exchange of gases in the lungs occurs across the [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Exchange of gases in the lungs occurs across the [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The respiratory membrane consists of the squamous epithelium of the alveoli and the endothelium of the surrounding blood capillaries.

question: Systemic aorta carries blood to [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Systemic aorta carries blood to [MHT-CET 2023]
options: C. All body parts except lungs
answer: C. All body parts except lungs
solution: The systemic aorta distributes oxygenated blood from the left ventricle to all organs and tissues of the body, excluding the lungs.

question: Which of the following is NOT a step in respiration? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is NOT a step in respiration? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: B. Diffusion of gases across alveolar membrane
C. Transport of gases by blood
D. Production of glucose in lungs
answer: D. Production of glucose in lungs
solution: Lungs are for gas exchange; glucose production is a metabolic process occurring elsewhere (e.g., gluconeogenesis in liver or photosynthesis in plants).

question: Blood pressure is higher in [MHT CET 2004]
question_latex: Blood pressure is higher in [MHT CET 2004]
solution: Arteries carry blood away from the heart under high pressure generated by the ventricles. Pressure drops significantly as blood enters capillaries and veins.

question: In a healthy human, blood group 'AB' has [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: In a healthy human, blood group 'AB' has [MHT-CET 2020]
options: C. Both Antigen A and B
answer: C. Both Antigen A and B
solution: Blood group 'AB' is determined by the presence of both A and B antigens on the RBC surface and no antibodies in the plasma.

question: Emphysema is characterized by [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Emphysema is characterized by [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Emphysema is a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) where alveolar walls are damaged, reducing the surface area for gas exchange.

question: Tricuspid valve is located in ........ side of the heart. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Tricuspid valve is located in ........ side of the heart. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The tricuspid valve guards the opening between the right atrium and the right ventricle.

question: Carbon monoxide is toxic because [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: Carbon monoxide is toxic because [MHT-CET 2016]
options: B. It has high affinity for hemoglobin than oxygen
D. It affects the brain directly
answer: B. It has high affinity for hemoglobin than oxygen
solution: Carbon monoxide ($CO$) binds to hemoglobin about $200-250$ times more strongly than oxygen, forming stable carboxyhemoglobin and preventing oxygen transport.

question: Heart of human is [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: Heart of human is [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: Human heart is myogenic because the heartbeat is initiated by specialized muscular tissue (SAN) rather than nerve impulses.

question: Which of the following ions is necessary for blood clotting? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which of the following ions is necessary for blood clotting? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Calcium ions ($Ca^{2+}$) are essential for several steps in the blood coagulation cascade, including the conversion of prothrombin to thrombin.

question: In humans, the right lung has ........ lobes. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In humans, the right lung has ........ lobes. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The human right lung is larger and divided into three lobes (superior, middle, and inferior) by two fissures.

question: Blood group 'O' person can donate blood to [MHT CET 2010]
question_latex: Blood group 'O' person can donate blood to [MHT CET 2010]
options: B. Only A and B groups
solution: Blood group 'O' individuals are universal donors because their RBCs lack A and B antigens, so they don't trigger an immune reaction in the recipient.

question: In an ECG, the QRS complex represents [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: In an ECG, the QRS complex represents [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: The QRS complex corresponds to the electrical activation and subsequent contraction (systole) of the ventricles.

question: Vital capacity ($VC$) of lungs is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Vital capacity ($VC$) of lungs is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Vital capacity is the maximum volume of air a person can exhale after a maximal inhalation. $VC = TV + IRV + ERV$.

question: A person with anti-A and anti-B antibodies in his plasma has blood group [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: A person with anti-A and anti-B antibodies in his plasma has blood group [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Blood group 'O' individuals have neither A nor B antigens on RBCs, so they produce both antibodies in their serum.

question: The second heart sound 'Dupp' is produced by [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The second heart sound 'Dupp' is produced by [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The second heart sound (S2) occurs at the beginning of ventricular diastole due to the closure of the aortic and pulmonary semilunar valves.

question: The right and left ventricles are separated by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The right and left ventricles are separated by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: A thick muscular wall called the interventricular septum separates the right and left ventricles.

question: Respiratory quotient ($RQ$) for carbohydrates is [MHT CET 2005]
question_latex: Respiratory quotient ($RQ$) for carbohydrates is [MHT CET 2005]
solution: For carbohydrates like glucose, the amount of $CO_{2}$ produced is equal to the amount of $O_{2}$ consumed, so $RQ = 1$.

question: Which of the following carries deoxygenated blood? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which of the following carries deoxygenated blood? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: The pulmonary artery is unique among arteries as it carries deoxygenated blood from the right ventricle to the lungs.

question: Bohr's effect is related to [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Bohr's effect is related to [MHT-CET 2021]
options: A. Shift of $O_{2}$ dissociation curve to left
B. Shift of $O_{2}$ dissociation curve to right
answer: B. Shift of O2 dissociation curve to right
solution: Bohr effect (increased $CO_{2}$ or decreased $pH$) causes the curve to shift right, meaning hemoglobin releases oxygen more easily.

question: Normal life span of a human lymphocyte is [MHT CET 2006]
question_latex: Normal life span of a human lymphocyte is [MHT CET 2006]
options: B. Few days to many years
answer: B. Few days to many years
solution: Lymphocytes vary greatly; some (effector cells) live a few days, while memory cells can live for many years, providing long-term immunity.

question: Blood entering the right atrium comes from [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: Blood entering the right atrium comes from [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: Deoxygenated blood from the entire body returns to the right atrium via the superior and inferior vena cava.

question: Maximum oxygen is carried by [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Maximum oxygen is carried by [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Red blood cells contain hemoglobin, which is the specialized protein for carrying $97\%$ of total oxygen.

question: The right side of the heart contains [MHT CET 2009]
question_latex: The right side of the heart contains [MHT CET 2009]
solution: In a four-chambered heart, the right atrium and right ventricle handle deoxygenated blood coming from the body.

question: Formation of RBCs is called [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Formation of RBCs is called [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Erythropoiesis is the process of producing red blood cells, which occurs primarily in the red bone marrow of adults.

question: Chordae tendineae are found in [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Chordae tendineae are found in [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Chordae tendineae are 'heart strings' in the ventricles that connect papillary muscles to the AV valves, preventing them from turning inside out.

question: Identify the incorrect statement about arteries. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the incorrect statement about arteries. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. They carry blood away from heart.
B. They have thick elastic walls.
C. They possess valves to prevent backflow.
D. They mostly carry oxygenated blood.
answer: C. They possess valves to prevent backflow.
solution: Arteries do not have valves (except at the base of aorta and pulmonary trunk). Backflow is not a concern due to high blood pressure. Veins have valves.

question: A rise in blood pressure is called [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: A rise in blood pressure is called [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: Hypertension is the persistent elevation of arterial blood pressure ($>140/90$ mmHg).

question: The primary site of gas exchange in humans is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: The primary site of gas exchange in humans is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: Alveoli are tiny grape-like air sacs at the end of bronchioles where $O_{2}$ and $CO_{2}$ are exchanged with the blood.

question: Heparin is secreted by [MHT CET 2011]
question_latex: Heparin is secreted by [MHT CET 2011]
solution: Basophils secrete heparin (an anticoagulant), histamine, and serotonin to mediate inflammatory reactions.

question: The covering of heart is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The covering of heart is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The heart is protected by a double-walled membranous sac called the pericardium.

question: Pacemaker of heart is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Pacemaker of heart is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The Sino-atrial node (SAN) is the natural pacemaker that initiates each cardiac cycle.

question: Which of the following is an occupational respiratory disorder? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is an occupational respiratory disorder? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Silicosis and asbestosis are occupational diseases caused by long-term inhalation of dust in industries like stone-breaking or mining.

question: Pulmonary artery carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Pulmonary artery carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The pulmonary artery is an exception; it carries deoxygenated blood from the right ventricle to the lungs.

question: In a healthy person, systolic pressure is ........ [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: In a healthy person, systolic pressure is ........ [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Systolic blood pressure is the maximum pressure in the arteries when the heart beats ($120$ mmHg).

question:
Match the terminology of respiration with their meaning.
(a) Eupnoea - (i) Normal breathing
(b) Dyspnoea - (ii) Difficult breathing
(c) Apnoea - (iii) Temporary stoppage of breathing
(d) Hyperpnoea - (iv) Rapid breathing. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match the terminology of respiration with their meaning. \\ (a) Eupnoea --- (i) Normal breathing \\ (b) Dyspnoea --- (ii) Difficult breathing \\ (c) Apnoea --- (iii) Temporary stoppage of breathing \\ (d) Hyperpnoea --- (iv) Rapid breathing. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Eupnoea is normal quiet breathing. Dyspnoea is painful/difficult breathing. Apnoea is stoppage. Hyperpnoea is increased rate/depth.

question: In a normal healthy person, if total number of WBCs is about $9000/mm^{3}$, then the number of Agranulocytes is about ........ / $mm^{3}$ of blood. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In a normal healthy person, if total number of WBCs is about $9000/mm^{3}$, then the number of Agranulocytes is about ........ / $mm^{3}$ of blood. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Agranulocytes (lymphocytes + monocytes) constitute about $28\%$ of total WBCs. $28\%$ of $9000 = 0.28 \times 9000 = 2520$.

question: Which of the following cells of formed elements secrete serotonin? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which of the following cells of formed elements secrete serotonin? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Basophils secrete serotonin, and thrombocytes (platelets) also release it as a local vasoconstrictor during the clotting process.

question: Select the correct group of organisms which carry out respiration through plasma membrane. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Select the correct group of organisms which carry out respiration through plasma membrane. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Simple aquatic organisms like sponges, coelenterates, and flatworms carry out gas exchange by simple diffusion over their entire body surface/plasma membrane.

question: Heart rate is controlled by ........ [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Heart rate is controlled by ........ [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Heart rate is regulated by the autonomic nervous system: Sympathetic nerves increase it, while Parasympathetic (Vagus) nerve decreases it.

question: Select the set of structures lined by squamous epithelium. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Select the set of structures lined by squamous epithelium. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Alveoli of lungs, epicardium, endocardium
B. Myocardium, myometrium, tunica Dartos of scrotum
C. Trachea, thyroid follicles and seminiferous tubules
answer: A. Alveoli of lungs, epicardium, endocardium
solution: Squamous epithelium consists of a single layer of flat, scale-like cells. It lines the alveoli for gas exchange and forms the internal (endocardium) and external (epicardium) linings of the heart.

question: Select the correct match with respect to WBCs. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Select the correct match with respect to WBCs. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: B-lymphocytes are responsible for humoral (antibody-mediated) immunity. Neutrophils and monocytes are phagocytic. Basophils secrete heparin and histamine.

question: In the treatment of use of protective mask and gear, minimize the risk of ........ [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: In the treatment of use of protective mask and gear, minimize the risk of ........ [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: Silicosis is an occupational lung disease caused by inhaling silica dust. Wearing protective gear like masks is the primary preventive measure for workers in stone-breaking and mining industries.

question: Blood platelets are formed from large cells called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Blood platelets are formed from large cells called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Thrombocytes (platelets) are not true cells but are cytoplasmic fragments pinched off from very large cells in the bone marrow called megakaryocytes.

question: The double layer of peritoneum that supports the heart is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The double layer of peritoneum that supports the heart is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The heart is enclosed in a double-layered sac called the pericardium, which consists of an outer fibrous layer and an inner serous layer.

question: Partial pressure of $O_{2}$ in deoxygenated blood is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Partial pressure of $O_{2}$ in deoxygenated blood is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The $pO_{2}$ in deoxygenated blood is $40$ mmHg, and $pCO_{2}$ is $45$ mmHg. In oxygenated blood, $pO_{2}$ rises to $95$ mmHg.

question: A muscular wall that separates the right and left atria is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: A muscular wall that separates the right and left atria is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The interatrial septum is a thin muscular partition that separates the two upper chambers of the heart.

question: Which of the following does NOT help in the transport of $CO_{2}$? [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Which of the following does NOT help in the transport of $CO_{2}$? [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: $CO_{2}$ is transported via plasma ($7\%$), as carbamino-haemoglobin in RBCs ($23\%$), and as bicarbonates in plasma ($70\%$). WBCs have no role in gas transport.

question: A temporary stoppage of breathing is called
question_latex: A temporary stoppage of breathing is called
solution: Apnoea is the temporary cessation of breathing. Dyspnoea is difficult breathing; Eupnoea is normal breathing; Hyperpnoea is increased breathing.

question: T-wave in an ECG represents [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: T-wave in an ECG represents [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The T-wave is a small, broad wave that represents the electrical recovery or repolarization of the ventricles.

question: Identify the incorrect statement about mammalian RBCs. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the incorrect statement about mammalian RBCs. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. They are biconcave and circular.
B. They lack nucleus at maturity.
D. They have a lifespan of 10 days.
answer: D. They have a lifespan of 10 days.
solution: Mammalian RBCs (erythrocytes) have an average lifespan of about $120$ days, not $10$ days.

question: The opening between the right atrium and right ventricle is guarded by [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: The opening between the right atrium and right ventricle is guarded by [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: The right atrioventricular orifice is guarded by the tricuspid valve, while the left is guarded by the bicuspid (mitral) valve.

question: Chloride shift is also known as [MHT-CET 2015]
question_latex: Chloride shift is also known as [MHT-CET 2015]
solution: Chloride shift involves the exchange of bicarbonate and chloride ions between RBCs and plasma; it is named the Hamburger phenomenon after Hartog Jakob Hamburger.

question: Normal count of RBCs in an adult male is about ........ million/$mm^{3}$. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Normal count of RBCs in an adult male is about ........ million/$mm^{3}$. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The normal average RBC count is $5.1$ to $5.8$ million per $mm^{3}$ in adult males and $4.3$ to $5.2$ million per $mm^{3}$ in adult females.

question: Heart rate more than 100 beats per minute is called [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Heart rate more than $100$ beats per minute is called [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Tachycardia is a faster-than-normal resting heart rate ($>100$ bpm). Bradycardia is a slower-than-normal rate ($<60$ bpm).

question: The total volume of air a person can exhale after a maximum inspiration is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The total volume of air a person can exhale after a maximum inspiration is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Vital Capacity ($VC$) is the maximum amount of air a person can expel from the lungs after a maximum inhalation ($VC = ERV + TV + IRV$).

question: Identify the blood group which contains Antigen B on RBCs and Antibody a in plasma. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the blood group which contains Antigen $B$ on RBCs and Antibody $a$ in plasma. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: In the ABO system, blood group $B$ has the $B$ antigen on the surface of RBCs and the anti-A antibody ($a$) in the plasma.

question: Erythropoiesis occurs in ........ in adults. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Erythropoiesis occurs in ........ in adults. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The process of formation of RBCs (erythropoiesis) takes place in the red bone marrow of long bones and flat bones in adults.

question: Inflammation of the larynx is known as [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Inflammation of the larynx is known as [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: Laryngitis is the inflammation of the voice box (larynx) from overuse, irritation, or infection.

question: Oxygen dissociation curve is [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Oxygen dissociation curve is [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: The relationship between the partial pressure of oxygen and the percentage saturation of hemoglobin is an S-shaped or sigmoid curve.

question: Agranulocytes include [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Agranulocytes include [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Agranulocytes are WBCs that lack cytoplasmic granules; they include lymphocytes and monocytes.

question: Foramen ovale is present in [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: Foramen ovale is present in [MHT-CET 2014]
solution: The foramen ovale is an opening in the interatrial septum of the fetal heart that allows blood to bypass the non-functional lungs.

question: Vena cava carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Vena cava carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The superior and inferior vena cava are large veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body to the right atrium.

question: An example of a respiratory pigment is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: An example of a respiratory pigment is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: Respiratory pigments are molecules that increase the oxygen-carrying capacity of blood; hemoglobin is the primary one in vertebrates.

question: The volume of air inspired or expired with each normal breath is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The volume of air inspired or expired with each normal breath is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Tidal volume ($TV$) is approximately $500$ mL in a healthy adult during quiet breathing.

question: A person with 'AB' blood group can donate blood to [MHT CET 2011]
question_latex: A person with 'AB' blood group can donate blood to [MHT CET 2011]
solution: Individual with group $AB$ can donate blood only to other $AB$ individuals because their RBCs contain both A and B antigens.

question: Exchange of $O_{2}$ and $CO_{2}$ in the lungs occurs by [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Exchange of $O_{2}$ and $CO_{2}$ in the lungs occurs by [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Gas exchange at the respiratory surface follows the law of partial pressures and occurs via simple passive diffusion.

question: Which of the following is an anticoagulant present in blood? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which of the following is an anticoagulant present in blood? [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Heparin is a natural anticoagulant secreted by basophils and mast cells that prevents blood from clotting inside the vessels.

question: The duration of ventricular systole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: The duration of ventricular systole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: In a cardiac cycle of $0.8$s, atrial systole lasts $0.1$s, ventricular systole lasts $0.3$s, and joint diastole lasts $0.4$s.

question: Emphysema is primarily caused by [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Emphysema is primarily caused by [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Cigarette smoking is the leading cause of emphysema, as it damages the alveolar walls and reduces lung elasticity.

question: The wall of the left ventricle is thicker than the right ventricle because [MHT CET 2008]
question_latex: The wall of the left ventricle is thicker than the right ventricle because [MHT CET 2008]
options: B. It has to pump blood to entire body
D. It is larger in size
answer: B. It has to pump blood to entire body
solution: The left ventricle must generate much higher pressure than the right ventricle to push blood through the long systemic circuit.

question: Which of the following is a symptom of hypertension? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is a symptom of hypertension? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Hypertension often shows no symptoms initially, but severe cases can cause headaches, dizziness, and palpitations.

question: Most of the $CO_{2}$ is transported in blood as [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Most of the $CO_{2}$ is transported in blood as [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The majority ($70\%$) of carbon dioxide is carried in the form of bicarbonate ions in the plasma.

question: The pH of human blood is approximately [MHT CET 2004]
question_latex: The pH of human blood is approximately [MHT CET 2004]
solution: Human blood is slightly alkaline, with a normal $pH$ range of $7.35$ to $7.45$.

question: Which of the following is a primary lymphoid organ? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which of the following is a primary lymphoid organ? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Primary lymphoid organs are where lymphocytes originate and mature; they include bone marrow and thymus. Spleen and lymph nodes are secondary.

question: Angina pectoris is [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Angina pectoris is [MHT-CET 2019]
options: B. Chest pain due to low blood supply to heart
answer: B. Chest pain due to low blood supply to heart
solution: Angina is discomfort or pain in the chest that occurs when heart muscle doesn't get enough oxygen-rich blood.

question: The instrument used to record the electrical activity of heart is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: The instrument used to record the electrical activity of heart is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: The machine is the electrocardiograph; the recording produced is the electrocardiogram (ECG).

question: Bilirubin and biliverdin are [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Bilirubin and biliverdin are [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: These are waste products produced from the breakdown of hemoglobin in the liver.

question: Total number of chambers in human heart is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Total number of chambers in human heart is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Mammals, including humans, have a four-chambered heart consisting of two atria and two ventricles.

question: Vital capacity ($VC$) = [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Vital capacity ($VC$) = [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Vital capacity is the sum of tidal volume, inspiratory reserve volume, and expiratory reserve volume.

question: The valve between left atrium and left ventricle is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The valve between left atrium and left ventricle is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Also known as the mitral valve, it prevents blood from flowing back into the left atrium.

question: Serum is defined as [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: Serum is defined as [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Serum is plasma that has had its clotting proteins (like fibrinogen) removed.

question: Partial pressure of $CO_{2}$ in atmospheric air is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Partial pressure of $CO_{2}$ in atmospheric air is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: $CO_{2}$ makes up $0.03\%$ of air, giving it a partial pressure of approximately $0.3$ mmHg at sea level.

question: Rh factor was first discovered in [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Rh factor was first discovered in [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The Rh factor is named after the Rhesus monkey, where it was first identified by Landsteiner and Wiener in 1940.

question: A decrease in WBC count is called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: A decrease in WBC count is called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Leukopenia is an abnormally low white blood cell count ($<4000/mm^{3}$).

question: The state of heart when heart muscle is suddenly damaged by inadequate blood supply is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The state of heart when heart muscle is suddenly damaged by inadequate blood supply is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: A heart attack (myocardial infarction) occurs when the blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked, causing muscle damage.

question: Systemic circulation involves [MHT-CET 2015]
question_latex: Systemic circulation involves [MHT-CET 2015]
options: A. Left ventricle -> body -> right atrium
B. Right ventricle -> lungs -> left atrium
C. Left atrium -> body -> right ventricle
D. Right atrium -> body -> left ventricle
answer: A. Left ventricle -> body -> right atrium
solution: Systemic circulation pumps oxygenated blood from the left ventricle through the aorta to the body and returns it to the right atrium.

question: A common symptom of asthma is [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: A common symptom of asthma is [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Wheezing is a whistling sound made while breathing, characteristic of the airway constriction found in asthma.

question: Pulmonary vein carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Pulmonary vein carries ........ blood. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The pulmonary veins are the only veins in the human body that carry oxygenated blood (from lungs to left atrium).

question: Blood pressure is measured in [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Blood pressure is measured in [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Blood pressure is standardly measured in millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

question: Which of the following is correct about the pace maker of heart? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is correct about the pace maker of heart? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: D. It is Bundle of His.
solution: The SA node (Sinoatrial node) is the natural pacemaker because it generates electrical impulses at a regular rate.

question: Erythroblastosis fetalis occurs when [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Erythroblastosis fetalis occurs when [MHT-CET 2019]
options: A. Mother is Rh- and Father is Rh+
B. Mother is Rh+ and Father is Rh-
answer: A. Mother is Rh- and Father is Rh+
solution: If the child inherits Rh+ from the father, the Rh- mother may produce antibodies that attack the fetus's blood cells.

question: Oxygen binds to hemoglobin to form [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Oxygen binds to hemoglobin to form [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: One molecule of hemoglobin can bind up to four molecules of oxygen to form oxyhemoglobin.

question: Residual volume is the volume of air [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Residual volume is the volume of air [MHT-CET 2024]
options: C. Remaining in lungs after forced expiration
D. Remaining in lungs after normal expiration
answer: C. Remaining in lungs after forced expiration
solution: Residual volume ($RV$) ensures that lungs never completely collapse and gas exchange continues.

question: Normal diastolic pressure is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Normal diastolic pressure is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Diastolic pressure is the minimum arterial pressure during relaxation of the ventricles.

question: Identify the type of respiration in fish. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the type of respiration in fish. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Branchial respiration is breathing through gills, which is the specialized organ for gas exchange in aquatic fish.

question: Blood group 'AB' is called universal recipient because [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Blood group 'AB' is called universal recipient because [MHT-CET 2021]
options: A. It has no antibodies in plasma
B. It has no antigens on RBCs
C. It has both A and B antibodies
D. It has Antibody a only
answer: A. It has no antibodies in plasma
solution: Because it lacks anti-A and anti-B antibodies, it can receive RBCs from any blood group without a reaction.

question: The duration of atrial systole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: The duration of atrial systole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: Atrial systole is the contraction of the atria, pushing the last $25-30\%$ of blood into the ventricles.

question: Carbonic anhydrase facilitates the reaction [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Carbonic anhydrase facilitates the reaction [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: This enzyme speeds up the formation of carbonic acid from $CO_{2}$ and water in the tissues, and the reverse in the lungs.

question: Universal donor blood group is [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Universal donor blood group is [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Blood group $O$ can be given to any patient in an emergency because it lacks A and B antigens.

question: Larynx is commonly known as [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Larynx is commonly known as [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The larynx contains the vocal cords and is responsible for sound production.

question: The study of blood is called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The study of blood is called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Hematology is the branch of medicine concerned with the study of the cause, prognosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases related to blood.

question: Heart sound S1 is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Heart sound $S1$ is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The 'Lubb' sound is lower in pitch and longer in duration than the 'Dupp' sound.

question: Functional residual capacity ($FRC$) is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Functional residual capacity ($FRC$) is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $FRC$ is the volume of air remaining in the lungs after a normal passive expiration.

question: Heart sound S2 is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Heart sound $S2$ is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: The 'Dupp' sound is sharper, higher-pitched, and shorter in duration.

question: Normal heart beat is ........ beats/min. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Normal heart beat is ........ beats/min. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The standard average value for human heart rate is $72$ beats per minute.

question: The transport of $CO_{2}$ as carbamino-haemoglobin is about ........ %. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The transport of $CO_{2}$ as carbamino-haemoglobin is about ........ \%. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $CO_{2}$ reacts with the amine groups of hemoglobin to form carbamino-haemoglobin ($HbCO_{2}$).

question: Blood pressure is highest in [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Blood pressure is highest in [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Blood pressure is at its peak in the aorta, immediately after being pumped out of the left ventricle.

question: WBCs are also called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: WBCs are also called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: White blood cells are broadly classified as leukocytes.

question: Total duration of cardiac cycle is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Total duration of cardiac cycle is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: One complete heartbeat or cardiac cycle takes roughly $0.8$ seconds to complete.

question: A rise in blood pressure above 140/90 is [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: A rise in blood pressure above $140/90$ is [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: Hypertension is defined as persistent blood pressure levels higher than the normal threshold.

question: The pacemaker of heart is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The pacemaker of heart is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Sinoatrial node initiates the electrical impulse that travels through the heart.

question: Inspiration is a ........ process. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Inspiration is a ........ process. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Inspiration is active because it requires the contraction of the diaphragm and external intercostal muscles.

question: Expiration is a ........ process during quiet breathing. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Expiration is a ........ process during quiet breathing. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Normal expiration is passive as it relies on the elastic recoil of the lungs and relaxation of muscles.

question: The oxygen-carrying pigment in blood is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The oxygen-carrying pigment in blood is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Hemoglobin binds reversible with oxygen to facilitate its transport to tissues.

question: Blood pressure is measured using a [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Blood pressure is measured using a [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: A sphygmomanometer is the standard instrument used to check blood pressure levels.

question: Normal blood pressure is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Normal blood pressure is ........ mmHg. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Normal BP is defined as a systolic of $120$ and a diastolic of $80$ mmHg.

question: Leukocytosis is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Leukocytosis is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: An elevated WBC count often indicates the body is fighting an infection.

question: Leukopenia is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Leukopenia is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: A low WBC count can be caused by certain diseases or medications.

question: A rise in platelet count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: A rise in platelet count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Thrombocytosis is the medical term for having an unusually high number of platelets.

question: A decrease in platelet count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: A decrease in platelet count is called [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Low platelet count can lead to bruising and excessive bleeding.

question: The time duration of joint diastole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The time duration of joint diastole is ........ second. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Joint diastole is the phase where both atria and ventricles are relaxed.

question: ECG helps to diagnose [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: ECG helps to diagnose [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: ECG provides information about heart rate, rhythm, and potential damage.

question: The QRS complex in ECG represents [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The $QRS$ complex in ECG represents [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Electrical depolarization of ventricles triggers their contraction (systole).

question: P-wave represents [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: $P$-wave represents [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Depolarization of atria leads to their contraction (systole).

question: T-wave represents [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: $T$-wave represents [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Repolarization is the electrical recovery preceding relaxation (diastole).

question: Pulmonary artery carries blood from ........ to ........ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Pulmonary artery carries blood from ........ to ........ [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: It carries deoxygenated blood to the lungs for oxygenation.

question: Pulmonary vein carries blood from ........ to ........ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Pulmonary vein carries blood from ........ to ........ [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: It returns freshly oxygenated blood back to the heart.

question: Normal heart rate is about ........ times/min. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Normal heart rate is about ........ times/min. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Normal resting rate is typically around $72$ beats per minute.

question: The time duration of cardiac cycle is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The time duration of cardiac cycle is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Calculated by dividing $60$ seconds by the heart rate ($75$ bpm).

question: Which of the following is a symptom of heart failure? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is a symptom of heart failure? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Congestion in lungs leads to difficulty in breathing.

question: SA Node is located in the [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: $SA$ Node is located in the [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Found in the upper wall of the right atrium near the superior vena cava.

question: AV Node is located in the [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: $AV$ Node is located in the [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Found in the lower left corner of the right atrium near the septum.

question: Which of the following is the 'natural pacemaker'? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is the 'natural pacemaker'? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: It has the highest intrinsic rate of firing.

question: What is the role of Purkinje fibers? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: What is the role of Purkinje fibers? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: They distribute the electrical signal throughout the ventricular myocardium.

question: Blood group O has ........ antigens. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Blood group $O$ has ........ antigens. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Absence of surface antigens allows it to be donated widely.

question: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I: Respiration is the process of release of energy from the food. Statement-II: Respiration is the only source of energy for repairs and replacement of worn out parts through the energy released in form of ATP. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I: Respiration is the process of release of energy from the food. Statement-II: Respiration is the only source of energy for repairs and replacement of worn out parts through the energy released in form of ATP. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: B. Both statement-I and statement-II are correct.
C. Both statement-I and statement-II are incorrect.
D. Statement-I is correct but statement-II is incorrect.
answer: D. Statement-I is correct but statement-II is incorrect.
solution: Respiration is the primary process for energy release ($ATP$), but stating it is the 'only' source for repairs is technically too restrictive in a broader biochemical context.

question: Heart failure occurs due to following factors EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Heart failure occurs due to following factors EXCEPT [MHT-CET 2020]
options: A. adequate supply of nutrients and oxygen.
B. progressive weakening of cardiac muscles.
C. increase in the afterload on the heart due to hypertension.
answer: A. adequate supply of nutrients and oxygen.
solution: Adequate supply provides ideal conditions; its absence leads to failure.

question: The center antagonistic to pneumotaxic center in the medulla is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The center antagonistic to pneumotaxic center in the medulla is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The apneustic center promotes inhalation, while the pneumotaxic center inhibits it.

question: SA Node is called pacemaker of heart because it [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: $SA$ Node is called pacemaker of heart because it [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. has power of generating a new wave of contraction
B. passes the wave of contraction to A V Node
C. is dependent on nervous inputs
D. spreads the wave of contraction in atrial wall
answer: A. has power of generating a new wave of contraction
solution: Its ability for self-excitation sets the pace for the whole heart.
